channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MT

item.title: Report I-2023060146
item.description:
Report I-2023060146

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: Missoula
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: REDDAWAY DRIVERS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the trailer, three batteries were found damaged and Ieaking. The release was properly managed. The damaged batteries were placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2023060645
item.description:
Report E-2023060645

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBG experienced a UN1830 Nalco 2597 release from a 200-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 2" x 2"' area of the tote body due to a loose lid. The tote was wiped down with absorbent rags. Several bolts on the tote were tightened to prevent further release. All cleanup debris was placed into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
